item.title: Kevin add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description:
"Be patient, Ophelia.
Love, Hamlet" -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "He bowed at the dark, straightened, tossed his hat over his shoulder, and, carrying the muleta in his left hand and the sword in his right, walked out toward the bull." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "How teach again, however, what has been taught correctly and incorrectly learned a thousand thousand times, throughout the millenniums of mankind's prudent folly? That is the hero's ultimate difficult task." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "Wherever the poetry of myth is interpreted as biography, history, or science, it is killed." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "But the makers of legend have seldom rested content to regard the world's great heroes as mere human beings who broke past the horizons that limited their fellows and returned such boons as any man with equal faith and courage might have found." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Kevin add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "But the fact that some geniuses were laughed at does not imply that all who are laughed at are geniuses. They laughed at Columbus, they laughed at Fulton, they laughed at the Wright brothers. But they also laughed at Bozo the Clown." -- Carl Sagan
